intro: Marina grammadenia, commonly known as the Grammadenia marina, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
